item.content:encoded:
Good article and good points. I myself have a ‘tools’ database in this database I have

an Auxiliary table of numbers
formatting functions
calculation functions
Zip code and address tables
ISO country and currency code tables
Region and country specific calendar tables

This way if I have a bug there is only one place I have to fix it. I also don’t need to make changes to my zip code table in 6 different database and this will also reduce a little bit of storage
